Agenda Topic
Discussion
Motions/Actions 
Roll Call & Pledge of Allegiance
The Board recited the Pledge of Allegiance and Roll Call for the meeting was taken. 


Agenda and Previous Meeting Minutes
The agenda and minutes from 11/19/20 were provided for review. 

MOTION: A motion by Kedrick Morris and a 2nd by Karen White to approve the agenda and previous meeting minutes passed unanimously via roll call. 

Public Comment

The Board opened up the meeting for public comment. The Board read an email from Ms. Kiera Durfee, a teacher at the Ranches Academy. 


COVID-19 Update by Susie Scherer
The Director discussed emails she received from parents asking about returning to the normal school schedule. 


School Land Trust update by Susie Scherer
The Board was informed of the actions that Susie has taken in regards to the School Land Trust updates. 


Discuss and vote on 2021-2022 School Calendar

The board reviewed the 2021-2022 school calendar.  

MOTION: A motion by Preston Griffin and a 2nd by Kedrick Morris to approve the 2021-2022 School Calendar passed unanimously via roll call.

Review 2020-21 Strategic Plan Goals and action plans & review Charter Goals

The Board reviewed and discussed the Director's goals for the 2020-21 school year. 


Review budget -  Discussion and input on COVID Relief Act

The Board reviewed the budget and discussed extending the COVID Relief Act of 80/56 PTO hours allotment through March 31st despite it not being covered by the federal government at this time. 


MOTION: A motion by Paul Jerome and a 2nd by Karen White to approve extending coverage of the COVID Relief Act of 80/56 PTO hours through March 31st passed unanimously via roll call.

Board Training -  Review Internal Audit Training
The Board reviewed the Internal Audit Training video.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GOKI9OstU-U

Reed Ryan made a recommendation to have The Board Vice-Chair (Rachel Dabel) serve as the Chair of The Audit Committee and Kedrick Morris as an Audit Committee member.  The third member will be a member of the community. 

Paul Jerome recommended that he and Linda Tuttle not be members of the Audit Committee but attend the meetings as advisors to The Board.

The Board identified Paul Jerome as Internal Auditor for the school.


ACTION: Rachel Dabel will provide an update to The Board on the progress of the Audit Committee organization.

ACTION: Susie Scherer will solicit for a community member of the Audit Committee.
Board Executive Policy Review for: Board Global Ends Policy, Board Job Description, and Board Meeting Monitoring Report
The Board reviewed the Board Global Ends Policy.  A section was clarified to add the education was evidence based.

The Board reviewed the Board Job Description.  Clarification was added as to the policies described were that of the executive governing policies.

The Board reviewed the Board Meeting Monitoring Report.

ACTION: Preston Griffin to add the Board Meeting Monitoring Report to the calendar to be completed twice a year. 

MOTION: A motion by Rachel Dabel and a 2nd by Michelle Keyte to approve the changes made to the policies unanimously via roll call.
New Business
No new business was discussed. 


Adjourn
8:55PM
MOTION: A motion by Paul Jerome and a 2nd by Rachel Dabel to adjourn passed unanimously via roll call.

Review budget and vote on possible amendment for technology

The Board discussed increasing the budget for bonuses for faculty and staff along with an increase in budget to Technology Hardware.

The Board reviewed and discussed the Accountability of Director, Asset Protection and Board Agenda policy documents.
ACTION: Susie Scherer to remove item 3 from Accountability of the Director document.

ACTION: Susie Scherer to remove the 'Certification' section of the Asset Protection document.

MOTION: A motion by Paul Jerome and 2nd by Michelle Keyte to approve the Accountability of Director, Asset Protection and Board Agenda.

Vote passed unanimously via roll call

Board Training - Open and Public Meetings Act
The Board received training from Rachel Dabel on the Open and Public Meetings Act.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/11ibTveYuDMAuDv8wLG6MhZH6S5KMEfDf/view?usp=sharing


Discuss Open Board Position and Vote on Board Appointments or Re-Appointments 
The Board appointed Preston Griffin as Board Secretary and Reed Ryan as Board Chair. Both received unanimous support from fellow board members.


New Business
No new business was discussed.

Adjourn
9:23PM
MOTION: A motion by Karen White and 2nd by Rachel Dabel to adjourn the meeting.

Vote passed unanimously via roll call.

meetings.agenda:
Salt Lake Arts Academy
Governing Board Agenda
April 16, 2021
3 p.m. Via Zoom
{ HYPERLINK 'https://zoom.us/j/94989033875' }
1. Welcome Lon Huntsman 3:00 2. Minutes from 3-19-21 All 3:05 3. School LAND Trust Plan for
2021-22 Katy Andrews 3:10
4. Finance
- FY2022 Budget - Action: Vote Expected John Bakken / Moni Schwaerzler 3:20 - Update on
Bond Reporting
5. School Schedule for 2021-22 Katy Andrews 3:45 Face Mask Policy beginning June 15
Action: Action Vote expected.
6. Policies Moni Schwaerzler 3:55 Fiscal and Auditing Policy Update
7. Board Member Nominations Lon Huntsman 4:05 Action: Vote expected.
8. Committee Updates 4:15 - Development/Outreach Katy Andrews
- Academic Achievement Julie Livers
9. Public Requests to Speak 4:30
10. Closed Session (The Governing Board may move into Closed Session to discuss topics allowed under the Utah
Open Meetings Law.)
*REQUEST TO SPEAK: Persons requesting to speak to the Governing Board in an open meeting need to sign up prior to the start of the open
session of the board meeting, by contacting Lon Huntsman, alonzo.huntsman@slarts.org. Resolution of questions or responses to proposals
should not be expected at this meeting; staff or others may be asked to research and/or prepare materials and solutions for a later time. Up to
fifteen minutes in
total will be scheduled for persons requesting to speak. Three minutes will be allotted for individual requests and five minutes will be allotted
for group requests. If we receive more requests than the allotted time permits, those requests may be scheduled for the next board meeting.
Your concerns may be submitted in writing to the principal's office for distribution to the Governing Board at any time.
Upcoming Events and Meeting
- Governing Board Meeting, April 16, 3:00 p.m. via Zoom
- Governing Board Outdoor Social, May 20, time TBD, Julie Livers' home
- Governing Board Meeting, May 21, 3:00 p.m. via Zoom
- Governing Board Meeting - Final Budget Approval, June 24, 4 p.m. via Zoom
- Governing Board Retreat / Kick of 2021-22, August 10, 4 - 7 p.m.

meetings.agenda:
Salt Lake Arts Academy
Governing Board PENDING MINUTES
March 19, 2021 at 3:00 p.m.
Via Zoom https://zoom.us/j/97201548372
 

 Board Members Present
Anneliese Booher, Jennifer Goldman-Luthy, John Bakken, Julie Livers, Leanne Hawken, Lon Huntsman, Matt Nelson, Rob Scott, Suyin Chong

Board Members Excused
Denise Begue, Melissa Block, Tatiana Mixco

Staff Present
Jen Guillory, Katy Andrews, Moni Schwaerzler

Others Present
Anne Cook, Sarah Vigil, Christina Hesley, Joy Pierce, Bhavana Katyal, Kelly Becker

Note: Attendance of participants joining during the Zoom meeting may not be recorded above


1.      Welcome and Introductions				Lon Huntsman   	     	3:00


2.       Review and Approval of Minutes from Board Meeting 3/12/21	All      	          	3:10

MOTION:  To approve the Minutes from the March 12, 2021 Special Governing Board Meeting
Leanne Hawken  moved to approve 
John Bakken  seconded 
Motion approved unanimously 


3.      Admin Report and Action Agenda			Katy Andrews		3:30

.         Four-Day In Person Learning Schedule, Vote Expected

Reviewed plan for continuing 4-period, 4-day schedule
Masks will still be required, and other safety measures
CDC just changed rule - now allowing 3 feet in schools
Salt Lake County Health Department walked through and approved our safety measures
About 12% of  kids still remaining remote; adjusting schedule for all-remote sections
Some outside performance opportunities will be added to calendar
School-wide art project - mural in front of school
May 26 unveiling ceremony with music
8th grade promotion outside on the field
8th grade Lagoon Day!

MOTION:  To approve the proposed four-day in-person learning schedule 
Anneliese Booher moved to approve 
Leanne Hawken seconded 
Motion approved unanimously 

.         Fee Schedule for 21-22 Vote Expected

Reviewed schedule
UTA pass amount may change - information not available at this time
If significant change, will need to amend
5th Grade Fees are all entirely voluntary
Need to include with registration information in mid April

MOTION:  To adopt the proposed 2021- 2022 Fee Schedule
Jennifer Goldman-Luthy  moved to approve 
John Bakken  seconded 
Motion approved unanimously

.        Calendar for 21-22, Vote Expected

Similar to SLCSD calendar, with variations specific to our school
Need to confirm hours/days with Deborah Candler when she comes on as Principal
Julie - Dates listed at bottom need to be consistent with those shown on calendar

MOTION:  To approve the proposed 2021- 2022 Calendar with anticipated changes
Julie Livers  moved to approve 
Suyin Chong  seconded 
Motion approved unanimously

.        Admissions Update

Acceptances are coming in
Final acceptances are due next Friday
We are in good shape


4.       Governance Committee				Lon Huntsman             	3:45          	
.         New Principal Announcement

Lon - Gratitude to Katy for having such a steady hand on the rudder as Interim Director!  We are so lucky as an institution to have her get us through this
Katy -  Mutual admiration society!  Board volunteers have also gotten us through
Deborah Candler signed employment agreement very much like previous at-will agreements
Lon - Deborah will be a strong leader for our school; very impressed by her energy and how people think of her; hopes she will be here for decades!  It's a hard job and she is up for it.
Need to go into closed meeting at end to review final terms
Deborah coming from Wasatch should increase enrollment numbers
Very optimistic!

.         Governing Board Nominations

Looking for CPA, help on Finance Committee; Jim Kreeck has helped for a long time
Katy - seeking to fill 4+ seats - Denise, Melissa, Jennifer, Stacey
Leanne has nominated Joy Pierce
Joy is a professor in Humanities Department at the University of Utah
Julie Bartel may also be interested in joining
Please reach out to your networks and our parent community
Review nominations in April, then vote
New folks would begin in the fall (August)
Hopefully next year won't be so challenging!


5.       Policy Updates					Anneliese Booher    		 3:55           
 
.        Harassment Policy, Vote Expected

Long policy because many details were updated last May by previous (federal) administration; were not in compliance by August; need to provide quickly
Reviewed other schools' policies, watched videos
We will need some training
Current policy requirements may change under new administration - possibly soon
Right now:
-- Must post non-discrimination blurb
-- Name and contact of our Title 9 Coordinator
-- Post policy on website
-- Train employees, especially definition of harassment
--Mandatory reporting under policy; our community needs to understand; even counsellors
Criticisms:
--Live hearings (but optional for us)
--Can bring in an advisor
--School-related conduct, possibly outside of school
--Different standards of proof
Praises:
--Require all schools to address harassment
--Procedural protections for accused
--Evidence sharing
Leanne - Was Title 9 Coordinator for the U; Anneliese's work is appreciated!

MOTION:  To approve the proposed Harassment Policy
John Bakken  moved to approve 
Julie Livers  seconded 
Motion approved unanimously

Katy will be sure teacher trainings are conducted and will keep board apprised.


6.      School Land Trust Report for 2019-20		Katy Andrews                      	4:10

Schools use state funding for most pressing needs - decided by school
School Trust Lands are redoing website and process. 

Last year (2019-20) received $48,000 from program
Went to support salaries for programs to support students (part of Jennifer Sanchez's salary)
Discussed changes Heather had made; Covid threw these measures out the window
But we were able to do day-to-day engagement monitoring with Zoom and applied interventions Followed up with students and made plans and tools to support them
Will file formal report online when their website is up and running
Board needs to vote in April on next year's Trust Lands funds
Will work to Increase student engagement, and hope to increase their proficiency
Not reporting this year
We will have RISE tests this year, too
In preparation for Digital Learning grant, we will train students to create digital portfolios
Will promote student self reflection, how they learn, how their learning has changed over time; they can track, take with them through high school
Pretest of portfolios - survey of student engagement in classrooms in December -
They are critical thinkers, and took issues with how questions were presented/phrased!
Survey has been retooled to make it more nuanced:  'I like this, but I don't like this'
Will do again next year


7.      Committee Reports									4:20

Finance						John Bakken / Moni Schwaerzler

Moni - Sent information in an email; reviewed
Added improving PA system to list - waiting for bids
No surprises in financing
More coronavirus funding coming
More funding from state
Wasatch Kids coming back in summer
Most funding comes from state; our fundraising is about the same as federal funding
Most expenses is teacher salary; next most is bond (significantly reduced now)
Lon - How are reporting requirements going?
Moni - We're all good
Lon - The Board is on the hook to make sure all reports are submitted for bond
Moni - Next report due in May; also must submit all Board minutes as available
Need program accounting policy in place, and also background check policy
Katy - Governance Committee needs to address
Moni - Student privacy protection - share no identifiable information on computer apps and programs; Moni is reviewing our apps to get agreements not to share information

Development/Outreach				Katy Andrews
            	
Katy - Not much to report; many folks on committee have been busy on hiring committee
Suyin has stepped up to teach After-School Spanish
Suyin - Huge group of beginners; many are coming from Emerson; doesn't just teach Spanish but also teaches about cultures
Katy - Meg Orsini is stepping up to head Parent Party Committee
Moni - Party when we can get together again
Katy - Julie will host Board party and invite Deborah

8.      Public Requests to Speak*				Lon /Public     		4:30

No requests


9.      Upcoming Events and Meetings			All      	        		    	4:40

.         Governing Board Meeting, April 16, 3:00 p.m.

.         Governing Board Meeting, May 16, May 21st 3:00 p.m.

.         Governing Board Retreat, June 18, 11:30 - 4:30 p.m. - DATE Options?
 
Lon - Obliged to approve budget for year by June 30; main function of retreat
Proposed having shorter board meeting to approve budget; then do a full day retreat with Deborah and new board members in August
General agreement
So change June 18 to shorter meeting later, possibly on Zoom; to confirm later

MOTION:  To move to a closed session to discuss Deborah Candler's salary
Leanne Hawken moved to approve 
John Bakken  seconded 
Motion approved unanimously

Moni and Katy will join in closed session; then move back to open meeting for vote
Christina Hesley - Taught with Deborah for 8 years and has nothing but positive comments about her professionally and personally


10.   Closed Session 
The Governing Board may move into Closed Session to discuss topics allowed under the Utah Open Meetings Law.
 

*REQUEST TO SPEAK: Persons requesting to speak to the Governing Board in an open meeting need to sign up prior to the start of the open session of the board meeting, by contacting Lon Huntsman, alonzo.huntsman@slarts.org. Resolution of questions or responses to proposals should not be expected at this meeting; staff or others may be asked to research and/or prepare materials and solutions for a later time. Up to fifteen minutes in total will be scheduled for persons requesting to speak. Three minutes will be allotted for individual requests and five minutes will be allotted for group requests. If we receive more requests than the allotted time permits, those requests may be scheduled for the next board meeting. Your concerns may be submitted in writing to the principal's office for distribution to the Governing Board at any time.

PENDING MINUTES
February 19, 2021 at 3:00 p.m
https://zoom.us/j/95687097536
 
Board Members Present
Anneliese Booher, Denise Begue, John Bakken, Julie Livers, Leanne Hawken, Lon Huntsman, Matt Nelson, Rob Scott, Suyin Chong,

Jennifer Goldman-Luthy, Melissa Block, Tatiana Mixco

Julie Livers moved to approve 
John Bakken  seconded 
Motion approved unanimously 


3. 	New Policies (Vote may be taken)			Anneliese Booher	3:10
Rob Scott
Grievance Policy
Rob - Joylin recommended we have this
People came directly to board with issues; better to have specific steps

Minor adjustments to policy - Discuss directly with person, then go to Dean of Students or Director of Academic Engagement, then Principal

Sexual Harassment Policy
Leanne is working on it


4. 	Committee Updates								3:20
 
Development and Community Outreach				Katy Andrews

Annual Campaign and Challenge Grant
Made campaign goal, got matching gift - about 26K from Catalyst! Well ahead of goal!  100% Board participation - thank you

Admissions/Enrollment update
Running lottery Monday
Good year to get into 5th grade!
Special events planned to snag people to accept and stay

Lon - extra agenda item brought up by Leanne
How will next year look?  How will virus play out?
Let's put on agenda for next time - want to be transparent.
Katy - We've been discussing a lot
Intent is to recommend regular in-person schedule, still masking
Some families will opt to stay remote.
Now that we are through this year, more vaccines to adults, school will probably be safe for kids to come in person
Rob - Kids down to 12 may be able to get vaccinated before fall

Principal Search Committee 				Julie Livers

Progress Report
Very excited about overwhelming response to job opening - great applicants
Top candidates to meet with faculty next week

Process Moving Forward
Two candidates meeting with faculty Wednesday via Zoom, to be recorded for Board
Get faculty feedback and input (a faculty member is on committee)
Things going very well - couldn't be happier!
Katy - Special board meeting for candidates to make presentations
Matt - sensitive to candidates and current positions - will discuss in closed session

 
5. 	Board Member Nominations				Lon Huntsman	3:45
 
Five members moving off Board
By end of term, five members moving off board - 
Denise and Matt have done their time; Stacey Mahan has left board - other pursuits; Melissa Block has moved; Jennifer GL also leaving - more work responsibilities (national board of pediatric mental health)
Lon thanks all these people!
Number serving on board is fluid, but need 'enough' and the 'right' people - 
Committees do work and bring to board

Skills to replace: CPA/Accounting, Community Relations, Fundraising, Marketing
Lon - Look for people who can help us in these functional categories
Katy - Reestablish connection with the University
Lon - Think about who we can find?
Next year, back in school, new principal - hours on board should decline :)
Julie - Tap into incoming 5th grade parents
Lon - Look for additional skill sets from people self-nominating, but focused selection would be helpful

Nomination Form and process
Katy will circulate nomination form to pass

Moni points
Shall she keep sending Financial Info notes prior to board meeting?
Washer/Dryer fiasco - need to get new ones
Pave north side of parking lot - would look nice and we have the money
 

6. 	Requests to Speak									3:50

If we receive more requests than the allotted time permits, those requests may be scheduled for the next board meeting. Your concerns may be submitted in writing to the principal's office for distribution to the Governing Board at any time.
 
The Board may move into closed session to discuss items allowed under the Utah Open and Public Meetings Law. A separate Zoom link will be sent to Board members, and the closed session will be recorded per the Open Meetings law. The Board may take Action during the closed session, which will be recorded per the Open Meetings law.

Matt Nelson moved to approve 
John Bakken seconded 
Motion approved unanimously

Motion approved unanimously
(Note: The Financial Discussion occurred first but is shown below in Item #6)
2. Approve Minutes of Governing Board Meeting 12/11/20 All 3:05
(No discussion)
MOTION: To approve Minutes from the December 11, 2020 Governing Board Meeting
John Bakken moved to approve
Rob Scott seconded
Motion approved unanimously
3. New Policies Anneliese Booher, Rob Scott 3:10
(Vote may be taken)
'At-Risk' Student Definition
Katy - Possible factors include absenteeism, course failures, disciplinary issues, displaced
living/homelessness, English language learner, low test scores
Based on State's qualifiers
Markell has identified other factors based on data (discussion)
We are tracking students in all categories with goal of making progress
Katy - Purpose of definition is to report at state leve.l
Asking Board to approve this definition; our plans to support kids at risk of failure address these
issues and more.
Lon - How to integrate other metrics Markell has identified?
Markell - We are doing these other things already, just not including in this report
Lon - So we are over and above what state is requiring.
MOTION: To accept definition of 'At-Risk Student' as students with any factors listed above
Julie Livers moved to approve
Leanne Hawken seconded
Motion approved unanimously
Grievance Policy
Tabled for future meeting
Harrassment Policy
Tabled for future meeting
4. Return to In-Person Scenario Discussion Katy Andrews / All 3:20
(Vote may be taken.)
Teacher Vaccine Update
Since December 11 meeting, all teachers have begun to be vaccinated
Proposed Scenario for Consideration
Katy - (Slide show, in handouts)
Grateful for the opportunity to bring this to you today
Have developed a plan to return students to classroom that address SLArts' core values
- Value and back up teachers and their health
- Offer what our kids need
- Balance what different families need
Also surveyed families by grade to commit to in-person or remote learning; still in Cohorts
Most families plan to return
- About 30% 5th graders plan to stay remote
- About 20-25% 6th-8th graders plan to stay remote
So about 300 people in-person; too many to physically distance, but fine for cohorts
Help kids make transition - kids are nervous about in person experience
- Focus on rebuilding our community in advance
- Also support kids remaining remote
Propose 4-day period with same cohorts; supported by Faculty and Administration
2 days in person, synchronous math and humanities 4 days per week, and arts
Pause non-arts electives
Continue remote Fridays; may offer remote classes on Fridays
Shorten day to eliminate lunch and significantly reduce risk of transmission
Solidify schedule by mid-Feb
John - Good news to get kiddos back in building; why pausing electives?
Katy - Arts are a core class here, so that will be kept; additional arts/electives will be paused
Some teachers will be teaching simultaneously in-person and online
Will redeploy electives teachers to support core teachers
Begin in-person about March 1
JenBS - Our goal is to try to keep the same teachers; depends on numbers
Katy - Teachers are ready to get back in building and will be vaccinated; we are set on this
JenGL - Addresses concerns getting kids back in school; unforeseen circumstances could
change plan, e.g. new strains of virus; need to keep eye on it; if we see in person spread we
may need to close
Katy - For our school size -- 15 cases means all remote again
question: raining or snowing?
Katy - Everyone bring a parka for snacks in bad weather! We will figure out details to stay safe
Leanne - Rapid testing/rapid return strategy possible?
Katy - Great idea - Planning committee is morphing into a 'now what' comm; creating and
implementing safety protocols is next on list
Everyone will need to use Healthy Together app prior to school each day; adults doing currently
Very strict about following protocols; will send students back to remote if not complying
Lon - Some parents would like more time in person, but there are limitations
Everyone must do their part to engage in safe behavior wherever you are
Most spreading occurs outside of school; school can be a safe, controlled environment
After school / at home must still be safe; and also keep ICUs from being overrun!
Katy - Beginning of day is check-in time so kids are heard and can process - we have all been
through trauma! we will process together
Nate - We will talk about how to be social when we are socially distanced!
Katy - We will develop mental health support for remote kids - a critical part of our community
Lon - Every change requires significant planning and retooling - plus burnout; our teachers care
deeply about our kids and the education process and the emotions - putting in a lot of work
MOTION: To adopt the proposed 4-period return to school plan
Jennifer Goldman-Luthy moved to approve
Rob Scott seconded
Motion approved unanimously
5. Requests to Speak 3:50
Persons requesting to speak to the Governing Board in an open meeting need to sign up prior to the start of the open session
of the board meeting, by emailing Lon Huntsman, chair, at alonzo.huntsman@slarts.org. Resolution of questions or responses
to proposals should not be expected at this meeting; staff or others may be asked to research and/or prepare materials and
solutions for a later time. Up to fifteen minutes in total will be scheduled for persons requesting to speak. Three minutes will be
allotted for individual requests and five minutes will be allotted for group requests. If we receive more requests than the allotted
time permits, those requests may be scheduled for the next board meeting. Your concerns may be submitted in writing to the
principal's office for distribution to the Governing Board at any time.
No requests to speak
6. Committee Updates 4:15
Finance John Bakken / Moni Schwaerzler
Presentation of the Revised FY21 Budget - Vote Expected
Sheila (auditor) - Has been auditing SLArts for 10+ years
Loves working with us; we do a great job
They look at Moni's books - all money in and all money out; all accounts to ensure accuracy
Also do compliance testing for state
Some testing has changed because of fraud at other charter schools
Opinion of report: Financial statements of SLArts are materially correct
Only one thing not clean involving about $2200
Everything else is very clean - Moni does a fantastic job
Bond covenance - we changed to new bond so it's monitored closely
All bond requirements met
Debt covenance projected to be met through end of school year
Lon - We were worried about some of these numbers, but we have 1.8% ratio cf required
1.15%, so we are in good shape
Personal responsibility to disclose information to bond holders; Moni has taken steps
We have retired previous debt, built addition, and still dropped debt service by $70k
Thanks to finance comm - John Bakken, Jim Kreeck (past), Rob Scott, Matt Nelson, Moni
Moni - (Share screen, in handouts)
Short version of budget - reviewed updated numbers
Balance sheet - reviewed
Bond holder conference this morning and we are in good shape
After 2020/21 'We are going to be so resilient we can turn the whole bloomin' world around!'
Lon - Looks good; those on Finance comm have spent a lot of time hashing through all these
things; we are in good shape
No worry with creditors
Lon - Moni is very careful about all terms
MOTION: To adopt new budget with new line items
John Bakken moved to approve
Matt Nelson seconded
Motion approved unanimously
Development and Community Outreach Katy Andrews
Annual Campaign and Challenge Grant
Within hairs' breadth of meeting $75k goal to unlock $25k challenge grant
Plus another $1000 challenge grant
Admissions/Enrollment update
Ambassadors came to school today to train for tours
Good attendance at tiny open houses
Lottery to be run on February 19
Please invite people to apply
Numbers are a little low; but this is the time most applications usually come in
We anticipate full enrollment
Principal Search Committee Julie Livers
Progress Report
Julie - 19 applications, several very good
Educators with adminisration license
Starting interviews with top picks 2nd week of February
Great batch of applicants - very optimistic!
Katy wants this moving ;)
Faculty input, great committee
Lon - Quality and caliber is very strong!
question: how many interviews
Julie - Plan to interview 3-5; beyond those is a very strong 2nd tier
Very impressive pool!
7. The Board may move into closed session to discuss items allowed under the Utah Open
and Public Meetings Law. A separate Zoom link will be sent to Board members, and the
closed session will be recorded per the Open Meetings law. The Board may take Action
during the closed session, which will be recorded per the Open Meetings law.
No Closed Session needed.
MOTION: to Adjourn meeting
Julie Livers moved to approve
Lon Huntsman seconded
Motion approved unanimously
Upcoming Meetings
Board Meeting, February 19, 2021, 3 p.m. via Zoom.
Admissions Lottery closes February 19.
Board Meeting, March 19, 2021, 3 p.m. via Zoom.

meetings.name: January Board Meeting Minutes
meetings.attachments: SPA Board Minutes 1-19-21 (2).docx Meeting Minutes Added: 2021/02/22 09:03 AM
meetings.agenda:
Board of Trustees Minutes 
January 19, 2021
In Attendance: 

Doug Keefe, Lucas Charon, Tracy Evans, John Craigle, Britni Manning, Willow Amendola, Steve Barth, Kit Anderton, Cassie Taylor, Varlo Davenport, Mindy Young, Becca Henrie, Tess Miller, Vicky Fitlow (Freshman Parent)
Not in Attendance: Kristi Swett, Chris Wright, Tim Porter, Krissi Anderson
This meeting was held virtually via a Zoom call
The meeting began at 6:35 PM
Review and Approval of Past Board Meeting Minutes - Doug Keefe
-	Minutes for November 17th, December 8th and 15th Board meetings presented and reviewed
-	John Craigle motioned to approve, Tracy Evans seconded.   Motion approved
-	Update SPA logo on these and other SPA published materials

SBO Report: Tess Miller
-	Planning online events through March
-	Need Board help for after school workshops, Tracy and Kit may help, consider jobs/activities after graduation
-	Backpack project - preparing for next school year
-	John C - Student video progress?  Discussing this week, will report back
Counselor Report: Willow Amendola
-	School registration for next school year begun, including parent meetings
-	Preparing for ACTs on March 9th
-	One junior graduating as a senior; moving to LA
-	Started home visits by administration, ramping up advisory activities.  Targeting at risk or struggling students
-	Increasing student activities
-	Hired a full time social worker at Highland, sharing the therapy services between SPA and Highland
-	Ramping up college prep activities, some students looking out of state, some considering a gap year; reengaging former students who took gap years to reapply this coming year
Administrative Report: Lucas Charon 
-	Students doing better in Q2 vs Q1, still too many students At Risk (one or more Fs)
-	COVID Update - District directing that they'll wait until teachers complete vaccinations before returning to school.  If we're delayed in the vaccinations, yet the District has completed their process and decided to come back, Board may need to make a decision on whether SPA will return - should be after next Board meeting
-	Enrollment at 225, holding steady.  35 new students interested in attending next year.  Ads on social media appear to be working

Financial Report: Britni Manning
-	Reviewed overview stats and trends only, referring to detailed reports that were distributed
-	Fiscal 2019/2020 Final Audit Report reviewed, with finding, drafted a response to the State
-	Budget update deferred to next Board meeting
-	PPP loan being considered, will move forward with an application then review and approve next meeting
-	Additional grant money expected beyond budgeted
PTO Update - None
Faculty Report: Varlo Davenport
-	Not just surviving, but thriving
-	Class Engagement - More intensive classes, high engagement.  SPA academic classes, a struggle; appears to skew towards freshman.
-	% of Students logging in - 85%+ on average. A different message from last meeting where reported severe lack of engagement.  Appears to have turned the corner.  May be in part survey error - i.e. Dance faculty skewed the favorable trends and results.  Not all faculty reported to him
-	With a viable vaccine coming, thoughts on coming back on site - Most willing and eager to get vaccine and return on site.  Hybrid learning - generally unfavorably viewed by teachers.  Would rather go one or the other way exclusively
-	Anything else for the Board - Nothing notable, appreciate the Board's and administration's efforts and support.  Parent communications continue to be challenged or often doesn't work Need a better way to communicate what we need from them Zoom teaching is challenging, but in many ways has forced improvement in teaching methods
-	Will distribute his notes to Lucas who will then redistribute to the Board
Marketing and Technology Committee Update - John Craigle and Mindy Young
-	Updated sign at entrance, needs installation; still working on the sign on front of building
-	Updated post card, introducing shadow days, etc
-	Photo shoots upcoming at school, January 27th and February 3rd, John to shoot, Mindy to direct
-	Update logo on all marketing materials
-	Overall look and feel of school and online presence needs update and investment - hire someone to do it well.  Building is falling apart, looks wragtag.  Why leave their beautiful, well funded local school and come to SPA.  Instagram has no pictures of kids, not geared towards kids.  Taking candid shots in the classrooms later in year
-	Need plans with cost estimates for budgetary purposes
-	Focus on marketing plans, supported by updated content.  We currently rely primarily on 'word of mouth'
-	Consider approaching local higher education for marketing help through internships
-	Need a common strategy and execution plans, then factor into budget updates
-	Shadow days start February 26th, get signs and materials fixed and improved before then
Fundraising Committee Update - Cassie Taylor
-	We have a list, a start; send thank you's as a next step, send to responders to the first solicitation.  Estimated average contribution of $45-50
-	Next, roll out appeal letters in April to prep for Fall
-	Contributions go directly to SPA, a non-profit 501c3
-	Track and classify donations to specific departments, although not legally restricted.  Should still encourage donating to specific departments or purposes
-	Lucas to set up committee meetings to facilitate further actions, for all committees
-	Cassie to convene a committee meeting, with Steve B in the wings
External Relationship Development Committee Update - Tracy Evans
-	Hale has created outreach videos, forward to Lucas who can distribute to teachers
-	Brainstorming on possible master classes, including audition training (online and in person), resume writing, career evaluation and self-marketing, headshot offerings, bring in Broadway experienced performers to advise, makeup/wigs, voice over work.  Obtain teacher input.  Kit composed an email to solicit teacher input, forward to Lucas for review.  Cassie will help as well
-	Some grants have been obtained to help fund these activities
-	Use marketing to invite community to master classes, possibly for a fee
-	Consider inviting parents to a follow up meeting after a master class
-	Pick an opening master class topic and get it going, consider audition technique, resume writing and headshots, self-marketing.  Target juniors for next year due to timing
Board Recruiting, Training and Compliance - Doug Keefe
-	Need one Board member to replace Tracy, looking to fill secretary position - Tracy has a candidate, send to Doug
-	Training - Online this year, Doug to distribute training schedules and sources
-	Good on conflict of interest forms, complete background checks for new members
Vicki Fitlow provided comments.  She is a freshman parent and serves as the Land Trust Chair for SPA.  She also serves on the Board at Weileman School in Park City
Next meeting will be Tuesday, February 16, 2021 at 6:30 PM
Steve Barth made a motion to adjourn the meeting at 8:12 PM.

meetings.name: January Board Meeting Minutes
meetings.attachments: SPA Board Minutes 1-19-21 (2).docx Meeting Minutes Added: 2021/02/22 09:03 AM
meetings.agenda:
Board of Trustees Minutes 
January 19, 2021
In Attendance: 

Doug Keefe, Lucas Charon, Tracy Evans, John Craigle, Britni Manning, Willow Amendola, Steve Barth, Kit Anderton, Cassie Taylor, Varlo Davenport, Mindy Young, Becca Henrie, Tess Miller, Vicky Fitlow (Freshman Parent)
Not in Attendance: Kristi Swett, Chris Wright, Tim Porter, Krissi Anderson
This meeting was held virtually via a Zoom call
The meeting began at 6:35 PM
Review and Approval of Past Board Meeting Minutes - Doug Keefe
-	Minutes for November 17th, December 8th and 15th Board meetings presented and reviewed
-	John Craigle motioned to approve, Tracy Evans seconded.   Motion approved
-	Update SPA logo on these and other SPA published materials

SBO Report: Tess Miller
-	Planning online events through March
-	Need Board help for after school workshops, Tracy and Kit may help, consider jobs/activities after graduation
-	Backpack project - preparing for next school year
-	John C - Student video progress?  Discussing this week, will report back
Counselor Report: Willow Amendola
-	School registration for next school year begun, including parent meetings
-	Preparing for ACTs on March 9th
-	One junior graduating as a senior; moving to LA
-	Started home visits by administration, ramping up advisory activities.  Targeting at risk or struggling students
-	Increasing student activities
-	Hired a full time social worker at Highland, sharing the therapy services between SPA and Highland
-	Ramping up college prep activities, some students looking out of state, some considering a gap year; reengaging former students who took gap years to reapply this coming year
Administrative Report: Lucas Charon 
-	Students doing better in Q2 vs Q1, still too many students At Risk (one or more Fs)
-	COVID Update - District directing that they'll wait until teachers complete vaccinations before returning to school.  If we're delayed in the vaccinations, yet the District has completed their process and decided to come back, Board may need to make a decision on whether SPA will return - should be after next Board meeting
-	Enrollment at 225, holding steady.  35 new students interested in attending next year.  Ads on social media appear to be working

Financial Report: Britni Manning
-	Reviewed overview stats and trends only, referring to detailed reports that were distributed
-	Fiscal 2019/2020 Final Audit Report reviewed, with finding, drafted a response to the State
-	Budget update deferred to next Board meeting
-	PPP loan being considered, will move forward with an application then review and approve next meeting
-	Additional grant money expected beyond budgeted
PTO Update - None
Faculty Report: Varlo Davenport
-	Not just surviving, but thriving
-	Class Engagement - More intensive classes, high engagement.  SPA academic classes, a struggle; appears to skew towards freshman.
-	% of Students logging in - 85%+ on average. A different message from last meeting where reported severe lack of engagement.  Appears to have turned the corner.  May be in part survey error - i.e. Dance faculty skewed the favorable trends and results.  Not all faculty reported to him
-	With a viable vaccine coming, thoughts on coming back on site - Most willing and eager to get vaccine and return on site.  Hybrid learning - generally unfavorably viewed by teachers.  Would rather go one or the other way exclusively
-	Anything else for the Board - Nothing notable, appreciate the Board's and administration's efforts and support.  Parent communications continue to be challenged or often doesn't work Need a better way to communicate what we need from them Zoom teaching is challenging, but in many ways has forced improvement in teaching methods
-	Will distribute his notes to Lucas who will then redistribute to the Board
Marketing and Technology Committee Update - John Craigle and Mindy Young
-	Updated sign at entrance, needs installation; still working on the sign on front of building
-	Updated post card, introducing shadow days, etc
-	Photo shoots upcoming at school, January 27th and February 3rd, John to shoot, Mindy to direct
-	Update logo on all marketing materials
-	Overall look and feel of school and online presence needs update and investment - hire someone to do it well.  Building is falling apart, looks wragtag.  Why leave their beautiful, well funded local school and come to SPA.  Instagram has no pictures of kids, not geared towards kids.  Taking candid shots in the classrooms later in year
-	Need plans with cost estimates for budgetary purposes
-	Focus on marketing plans, supported by updated content.  We currently rely primarily on 'word of mouth'
-	Consider approaching local higher education for marketing help through internships
-	Need a common strategy and execution plans, then factor into budget updates
-	Shadow days start February 26th, get signs and materials fixed and improved before then
Fundraising Committee Update - Cassie Taylor
-	We have a list, a start; send thank you's as a next step, send to responders to the first solicitation.  Estimated average contribution of $45-50
-	Next, roll out appeal letters in April to prep for Fall
-	Contributions go directly to SPA, a non-profit 501c3
-	Track and classify donations to specific departments, although not legally restricted.  Should still encourage donating to specific departments or purposes
-	Lucas to set up committee meetings to facilitate further actions, for all committees
-	Cassie to convene a committee meeting, with Steve B in the wings
External Relationship Development Committee Update - Tracy Evans
-	Hale has created outreach videos, forward to Lucas who can distribute to teachers
-	Brainstorming on possible master classes, including audition training (online and in person), resume writing, career evaluation and self-marketing, headshot offerings, bring in Broadway experienced performers to advise, makeup/wigs, voice over work.  Obtain teacher input.  Kit composed an email to solicit teacher input, forward to Lucas for review.  Cassie will help as well
-	Some grants have been obtained to help fund these activities
-	Use marketing to invite community to master classes, possibly for a fee
-	Consider inviting parents to a follow up meeting after a master class
-	Pick an opening master class topic and get it going, consider audition technique, resume writing and headshots, self-marketing.  Target juniors for next year due to timing
Board Recruiting, Training and Compliance - Doug Keefe
-	Need one Board member to replace Tracy, looking to fill secretary position - Tracy has a candidate, send to Doug
-	Training - Online this year, Doug to distribute training schedules and sources
-	Good on conflict of interest forms, complete background checks for new members
Vicki Fitlow provided comments.  She is a freshman parent and serves as the Land Trust Chair for SPA.  She also serves on the Board at Weileman School in Park City
Next meeting will be Tuesday, February 16, 2021 at 6:30 PM
Steve Barth made a motion to adjourn the meeting at 8:12 PM.

meetings.agenda:
Soldier Hollow Charter School Board of Trustee Meeting
October 20, 2020
3444 West 3000 South Charleston, Utah
(All times listed are approximate.  The Board reserves the right to vote on any item on the agenda)
___________________________________________________________________________________________
The Mission of Soldier Hollow Charter School is to utilize place-based education to foster autonomous, lifelong learning through knowledge of and responsibility for the environment.
___________________________________________________________________________________

1.	Welcome and Roll Call (6:30 p.m.)

2.	Public Comment (6:30 p.m.)  The public may address any issue not related to items already on the agenda.  Please refer to our Public Comment at Board Meetings Policy for procedures.

3.	Board Training- Rich Eccles
      	
4.	Reports (6:40 p.m.)
a.	Board Committees Report -Board action may be required - (10 min)

1.	PTO (Parent Teacher Organization) 
a.	Proposals
b.	Report of recent events, fundraisers & PTO balance
c.	Future events and preparations

2.	Financial Accountability Committee - Rich Eccles (15 Min)
a.	Financial statement from prior Month: Highlight key changes and budget variances
b.	Accept the Finance Report from prior month

3.	Facilities and Transportation updates
a.	Strawberry communications discussion

4.	Capital Fundraising - (15 Min)
a.	School field trips- fundraised monies  
b.	Wish List for the school--School Projects
c.	Landscaping update

5.	Academic Excellence- (10 Min)

6.	Executive Committee Report - (10 Min)
a.	  Policy Updates
b.	Approve meeting minutes from prior month

5.	Principal Report -Board action may be required - (20 min)
a.	Enrollment & Registration 
b.	Reports on school committees: 
i.	Special Ed, Public Relations / Website, Staffing, Curriculum, Testing & Training, EE, Art & Music, School Safety, Skiing, Skating Program & Olympics
c.	Concerns or issues with recommended resolutions

6.	Action Items:
a.	Accept the Financial report from prior month
b.	Approval of the Meeting minutes from prior month
c.	Approval of LEA Specific Policy 
d.	 Approval of LEA Specific License Application
e.	Approval of communications tower
f.	Approval of technology contract

Public comments: Please note the Board will not take action on an item introduced during this portion of the agenda pursuant to Utah Code 52-4-202(6)(b).
No public comments were made.
Director's Report
Faculty/Staff Changes:
Two paraprofessionals put in resignation, one for health reasons and another for internship opportunity.
Enrollment Update:
245 current, not including Williamsburg (40 additional), no change from last month. Next year 215, 28 8th, 38 9th, 53 10th, 53, 11th, 43 12th. Neil requested data on what students for next year are former GWA students.
Recent and upcoming events:
Valley academy 8th grade visiting next Wednesday. Invitations sent to Vista and GWA. Carnival is on May 22nd. Booth at county fair.
Reporting and Compliance:
Committee at SCSB approved metric change to our charter.
A single COVID case reported at SGA since last month.
Financial Report
Financials and Budget Review
Courtney reviewed the Budget to Actuals monthly report (Attached).
Committee Reports
Academic Excellence-Ami Jo and Matt
Committee is meeting the first week of April.
Finance Committee-Shane Laroia
Finance committee met to review responses to RFP for legal council on bond issue. Courtney presented the metric and score sheet for respondents (attached). Courtney and Christy met with the top 3. Finance committee is recommending Kirton McConkie.
Audit Committee-Shane Laroia
RFP for auditor is in progress.
Governance-Carol Vallejo
Board Training: Review UAPCS Training
Dee reviewed the training session provided by UAPCS.
Public Relations-Dee Wilson
Dee reported on the PTOs efforts to operate a booth at the county fair. Full page add will run with the 'Best of Southern Utah' awards magazine. Art festival does not have any booth spots available.
Discussion/Action Items
Update on Sale of Surplus School land
Waiting for Washington City to approve subdivision/plat.
2021 SY budget amendment
None
Review bids and select Borrower's Counsel
Motion by Steve to approve Kirton McConkie as borrower's council, second by Dee. Unanimous approval.
Update on Financial Advisor RFP
RFP's are due March 19, none received yet.
Board Training March 18, 2021
Scheduled for 6PM, Carol will conduct.
Faculty Survey
Student/Parent Survey
Neil provided proposed survey for responses. Christy advises student academic survey is out and should be complete next week. Discussion of purpose of survey and how the board would act on the results. Public relations committee and Academic excellence committee will refine the questions and survey the faculty.
Online Learning Options and Vendors for 2022 SY
Currently using the Williamsburg program and BYU program. Christy advised the board that the Williamsburg system has been more successful and easier to use for faculty. RFP would be needed for less than 15 students if using Williamsburg program due to cost and procurement rules. Canvas is available through SEDC as well.
Board Calendar
Discussion of items for board calendar. Neil will produce a draft for next meeting.
SGA Key Performance Indicators Dashboard
Discussion of existing KPI dashboard and any metrics we want to change going forward.
Closed Session to discuss the character or competence of an individual, real estate, or other approved topic. Roll call vote required pursuant to Utah Code 52-4-204, 205
No closed session was held.
Next Meeting:
Thursday March 18, 2021 at 6:00PM.
Adjourn
Adjourned at 6:50PM.

meetings.name: Board Meeting Minutes 2-11-2021
meetings.attachments: 2021 02 11 SGA Board Meeting Minutes.pdf Meeting Minutes Added: 2021/03/16 11:52 AM
meetings.agenda:
Start Audio Recording of Meeting
Welcome
Roll Call
Board Members attending: Neil Walter, Shane Laroia, Dee Wilson, Carol Vallejo, Brandon Sieverts, Ami-Jo Comeford, Steve Hurst.
Others attending: Christy Hall, Courtney Webb
Approval of Minutes
January 14, 2021
February 4, 2021
Motion by Dee to approve minutes with correction to Brandon's position with the PTO. Second by Shane. Unanimous approval.
Public comments: Please note the Board will not take action on an item introduced during this portion of the agenda pursuant to Utah Code 52-4-202(6)(b).
No public comments were made.
Director's Report
Faculty/Staff Changes:
No faculty/staff changes to report.
Enrollment Update:
Lost 12 Williamsburg students and 10 in house in Jan. Gained 5 students in house. Total 285 (245 in house). 9 Williamsburg students reside in Washington county. Discussion of continuing the relationship with Williamsburg will be on the agenda for the next board meeting. Continuing online learning with or without Williamsburg would require a charter amendment.
Christy reported on data provided in an exit survey of the 22 students that left SGA. 1 moved, 3 move, 3 health concerns, 1 left because of dissatisfaction with curriculum, 12 students were on the Leadership Academy waiting list, 2 enrolled and withdrew the first week of Jan.
For next year 202 students enrolled, 179 returning, 23 new (103 at this point in time last year). 20 new 8th grade students, mostly siblings of current students. Mix of students from WGA, Vista, and Valley.
Retention committee is working with 41 students that are answered 'Maybe' to the survey on if they were enrolling for next year. To date 11 of these are leaving, 13 staying, others still uncertain.
Christy provided an update about discussions with GWA administration. Would like to provide a shadow day for GWA students, but bussing is a problem (~75 7th graders).
Recent and upcoming events:
4 families attended recruitment event last week, 3 of which turned in applications, 4th family expected to apply.
Dance next month will be held, other details still in planning.
Virtual spitfire will be held outside as well. Masks will be required, no food provided so masks will stay on.
Reporting and Compliance:
Updating agreements and reviewing PII requirements with 3rd parties.
COVID Report
Two new cases this week, total 3 current. Several other students on quarantine from exposure outside of school.
Financial Report
Financials and Budget Review
Courtney reviewed the current financial report (attached). 990 is complete and filed, all 2020 reporting and filings now complete.
Courtney proposed SY21 budget amendments (attached, including summary of changes). Line items with changes include ~$144k additional revenue, ~$50k additional salary costs, ~$39k additional professional services costs, ~$13k additional costs in property services, ~$16k additional computer/tech costs. All changes net -$14,404 to income.
Committee Reports
Academic Excellence-Ami Jo and Matt
No report. ACT scheduled for March 23. State testing begins in April. No adjustments announced for COVID yet. Discussion of how to minimize opt-out.
Finance Committee-Shane Laroia
Land sale proceeds are probably 60 days out. Subdivision still waiting on city approval. Plan is to use proceeds to pay the Ashliman/Arch loans.
Shane and Courtney discussed plans to spend down restricted funds. Includes SITLA (robotic program) and SPED (SPED staff) monies. SPED spend down plan is approved by the state.
Audit Committee-Shane Laroia
Shane is working on developing an Audit Committee charter.
Governance-Carol Vallejo
Carol reviewed public notice compliance. The only missing items Carol identified is July 15 2020 meeting minutes. Neil has the minutes and will post.
Background Checks:
No changes to report.
Public Relations-Dee Wilson
Covered in upcoming events report previously by Christy.
Discussion/Action Items
Update on Sale of Surplus School land
Covered in finance committee report.
2021 SY budget amendment
Motion by Steve to approve proposed amendments, second by Shane. Unanimous approval.
Update on RFP for Legal Counsel and Financial Advisor
RFP draft is complete, state reviewed and suggest some changes. Both RFPs are posted. Feb 19 is deadline for legal RFP, March 19 for Legal.
Board Training Date for Board Members
Separate board meeting for training is scheduled for March 18 at 6PM.
Trust Lands Plan FY 2022
Christy presented the proposed plan (attached). Motion to approve as presented by Carol, second by Dee. Unanimous approval.
SGA Graduation Credits Policy
Christy presented the proposed graduation credits policy (attached). Discussion of modifying section 3.1.2 to clarify IEP students that complete all 3.1.1 requirements will receive a diploma. Wording of offered will also be changed to awarded. Motion by Matt to approve with two above changes, second by Carol. Unanimous approval.
SGA Performance Metrics
Christy reported on discussions with SCSB about metrics on our warning letter. After reviewing the these the metric requiring 70% of students score 20% above the national average on the ACT, is was determined to be nearly impossible to meet. After discussion with the state, Christy proposed the metric be changed to a more generic metric that measures performance relative to Public high schools within 15 miles of SGA. Motion by Ami-Jo to approve the replacement metric as proposed, seconded by Carol. Unanimous approval.
Closed Session to discuss the character or competence of an individual, real estate, or other approved topic. Roll call vote required pursuant to Utah Code 52-4-204, 205
No closed session held.
Reconvene - Take all appropriate action in relation to closed session items.
Next Meeting:
March 11 at 5:30PM.
Adjourn
Meeting adjourned at 7:48 PM

Address: 351 W UNIVERSITY BLVD Multipurpose Bldg MC205

meetings.agenda:
Syracuse Arts Academy
Board Meeting Agenda
Thursday, April 8, 2021
Place:  SAA North Campus, 357 S 1550 W, Syracuse, UT 84075

NOTE:  It is possible that the SAA Board of Directors may be utilizing an electronic meeting component with one or more of their members. 

Agenda	
											
2020-2021 School Priorities
Schoolwide Unity, Cooperation & Collaboration
Expansion of Arts Integration
Maximize All Data Sources to Improve Student Instruction and Performance

5:30 PM - Call to Order 
	Welcome by Bryan DeGrange (1 minute)  
	'Traditions' - The SAA Way
-	School Vision - Nate Schow (1 minute)  
-	Storytelling - Judy Nixon (3 minutes)  

5:35 PM - PUBLIC COMMENT (Comments will be limited to 3 minutes each)

5:35 PM - REPORTS
	Administration 
-	State of the School - Dale Pfister (20 minutes)  
	Board of Directors 
-	Financial Update - Rene Dreiling (5 minutes)  
	Academica West
-	AW Recap (5 minutes)  

6:05 PM - CONSENT ITEMS 
	New Hires
	December 3, 2020 Closed Session Affidavit
	February 4, 2021 Board Meeting Minutes

6:07 PM - BUSINESS ITEMS (To Be Discussed and/or Voted Upon)
	Right of Entry Agreement - Dale Pfister (5 minutes)  
	Purple Star School Resolution - Dale Pfister (2 minutes)  
	2021-2022 SLT Plan for Antelope Campus - Leigh/Jane Ann (5 minutes)  
	2021-2022 SLT Plan for North Campus - Judy Nixon (5 minutes)  
	Amended Purchasing & Disbursement Policy - Jon McQueary (2 minutes)  
	Amended Extended Curricular Student Travel Policy - Dale Pfister (2 minutes)

	Purchase of Technology Upgrades for the Amphitheatre - Dale Pfister (2 minutes)  

6:32 PM - OTHER BUSINESS ITEMS (Items for Discussion Only)
	Calendaring Items - ALL (5 minutes) 
-	Electronic Board Meeting - May 6th (if needed)
-	Next Pre-Board Meeting - June 3rd 
-	Next Board Meeting - June 18th Annual Board Meeting  
	REMINDERS: 
-	Audit Committee Training
-	Online Introductory Training for School Board Members (Fraud Risk)

6:37 PM - CLOSED SESSION to discuss purchase, exchange, or lease of real property pursuant to Utah Code 52-4-205(1)(d) and to discuss an individual's character, professional competence, or physical or mental health pursuant to Utah Code 52-4-205(1) (a) - ALL (15 minutes)  

6:52 PM - ADJOURN

meetings.attachments: No associated attachments
meetings.agenda:
Terra Academy Governing Board Meeting
267 Aggie Blvd., Vernal, UT 84078
	Terra Academy Library

All Terra Academy Board Policy and ByLaws can be found here: 
TERRA ACADEMY POLICY

Terra Academy Board members adhere to the following:
-	Know the charter and act to strategically uphold the vision and mission in our work.
-	Be informed, prepared and proactive through due diligence.
-	Represent the Terra Academy as a unified board.
Mission Statement: We treat every student as a whole 'unique' person, giving them individualized
instruction in a community model with project-based learning to nourish their
talents, skills and desires.

Vision Statement: Terra Academy helps students become independent lifelong learners who are respectful of
other cultures, are productive, and stewards of our environment.

School Rules: Be Respectful, Be Responsible, Be Kind
School Motto: Learn, Grow, Be

267 Aggie Blvd., Vernal, UT 84078
Thursday, April 15, 2021
	6pm Terra Academy HS Commons Area

This meeting will be held in the High School Commons area. Due to Covid 19, in person attendance for this meeting will be limited. Information is provided below for the public to attend this meeting electronically.

Public can attend electronically by using this link: meet.google.com/umv-dmpp-kde
(If you experience a problem attending the meeting by link, please attend by phone using number below)
Or Public can attend by phone: US 1 605-937-6894 Pin: 492 911 225#  

Minutes and audio recordings of meetings are always posted after the meeting and can be found on the Utah Public Notice
Website.

All Terra Academy Board Policy and ByLaws can be found here: 
TERRA ACADEMY POLICY

Terra Academy Board members adhere to the following:
-	Know the charter and act to strategically uphold the vision and mission in our work.
-	Be informed, prepared and proactive through due diligence.
-	Represent the Terra Academy as a unified board.
Mission Statement: We treat every student as a whole 'unique' person, giving them individualized
instruction in a community model with project-based learning to nourish their
talents, skills and desires.

Vision Statement: Terra Academy helps students become independent lifelong learners who are respectful of
other cultures, are productive, and stewards of our environment.

School Rules: Be Respectful, Be Responsible, Be Kind
School Motto: Learn, Grow, Be
1.	OPENING ITEMS/WELCOME							Jim LaMuth, Chair
a.	Call the meeting to order/Record Attendance and Guests
b.	Vision, Mission Reading/Review Board Goals				Governing Board

a.	Monthly Finance Report

a.	Monthly Report
b.	Fundraising/Activity Center Discussion Updates				Megan Earl, KayDee Massey
7.	ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE COMMITTEE 					Rachelle Durrant		
8.	BOARD GOVERNANCE								Jim LaMuth, Chair
a.	March 11, 2021 Meeting Minutes (Action Item)
b.	Attendance Data and Truancy Policy Review				Megan Earl, Asst. Director
c.	Open and Public Meetings Legislation Updates				Relin Wallis
d.	Policy Review (Possible Action Items)					Relin Wallis
i.	03-111 Administration of Medication (last review 12/14/2017)
ii.	03-112 Tobacco/Nicotine, Alcohol, and Drug Use Policy (last review 11/9/2017)

Jim LaMuth		09/17/2020
Loren Anderson		Incomplete

Tabitha Wilson		12/02/2020
Wes Porter		11/30/2020
	KayDee Massey		11/12/2020
9.	ADJOURN MEETING
*Next board Meeting is May 13, 2021
10.	EXECUTIVE/CLOSED SESSION
The Terra Academy Governing Board will meet in an Executive Closed Session for the purpose of discussing the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of an individual in conformance with 52-4-204 and 52-4-205 Utah Code


Accessibility: Any person requiring an accommodation should provide advance notice by contacting Cassie Hays, 267 Aggie Blvd., Vernal Utah, 844-322-6562 prior to this meeting.  
The following are in accordance with UCA 52-4 The Open and Public Meeting Act:  

Public Comment Guidelines: Members of the public are welcomed to Terra Governing Board meetings. Please respect the time limit to ensure ample time for the board to conduct their scheduled business. The following are guidelines for presenting comments:
-	Comments should be submitted in writing at the time of presentation as a matter of record.
-	Comments shall be addressed respectfully to the entire board through the chair. Comments shall not include complaints about school or board personnel; refer instead to 01-103 Complaint Policy.
-	Time for comments shall be limited to 3 minutes per person. A time limit of 15 minutes total for public comment will be observed to ensure ample time for the board to conduct its scheduled business.

Closed Meeting (Executive or Closed Session): As a regular agenda item, The Board may consider a motion to close the meeting to hold a strategy session to discuss pending or reasonably imminent litigation, and/or to discuss the purchase, exchange, or lease of real property, and/or the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of an individual in conformance with 52-4-204 and 52-4-205 Utah Code.

April 14, 2021   5:30 P.M.
TECS South Campus:  1275 W 2350 S, Nibley, UT 84321


Mission: We provide all students the fundamental knowledge, tools, and discipline to become successful, reputable citizens in our country and to become high achievers in our ever evolving, demanding and complex society.

Note:
Due to the current pandemic, this meeting will be held electronically.  Please go to the following web address to participate: meet.google.com/crr-xcpj-xmv or by phone 225-417-1038  PIN:  854 893 952 #.

meetings.agenda:
Board of Tuacahn High School for the Arts

Notice is hereby given that Board of Tuacahn High School for the Arts (THSA) will hold a special public meeting on Monday, March 1, 2021 at 5:00 pm.  Due to Chair Hafen's determination contained in the body of the below agenda, the public meeting will be held electronically via Zoom and live streamed on THSA's YouTube channel.  Public meetings conducted via Zoom may be terminated at any time due to hackers or inappropriate content.
 
Meetings of the Board may be conducted via electronic means pursuant to Utah Code Ann. 52-4-209(2)(a) and 52-4-207(4), as amended.  
 
The THSA Board, in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, provides accommodations and services for those members of the public in need of assistance.  Persons requesting these accommodations for the above-scheduled public hearing should contact Kent Brown at kbrown@tuacahnhs.org or 435-652-3303, giving at least 24 hours' notice prior to the meeting. 
 
AGENDA
 
1. Welcome and Roll Call
 
2. Chair's Determination Letter.  In accordance with Utah Code 54-2-209 and 52-4-207(4) and of the Utah Open and Public Meeting Act, I have determined that conducting an electronic meeting of the THSA Board with an anchor location presents a substantial risk to the health and safety of those who may be present at the anchor location.  This determination is based on the facts and circumstances surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic.  Considering the continued number of COVID-19 case counts in Utah, meeting at an anchor location presents substantial risk to the health and safety of those in attendance because physical distancing measures may be difficult to maintain at the anchor location.

Watch via YouTube Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcGR1APVDgBwCUmvuPGicOA
 
Join via Zoom Meeting: 

Time: Mar 1, 2021 05:00 PM Mountain Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83728133555?pwd=ZlJTRFR0dUMrdjJPcm94cm8wT0hGdz09

Meeting ID: 837 2813 3555
Passcode: 815775
One tap mobile
+13462487799,,83728133555# US (Houston)
+16699009128,,83728133555# US (San Jose)

Dial by your location
        +1 346 248 7799 US (Houston)
        +1 669 900 9128 US (San Jose)
        +1 253 215 8782 US (Tacoma)
        +1 312 626 6799 US (Chicago)
        +1 646 558 8656 US (New York)
        +1 301 715 8592 US (Washington DC)

Meeting ID: 837 2813 3555
Find your local number: https://us02web.zoom.us/u/kd1jfBdLTR
 
3.  Closed session pursuant to Utah Code 52-4-205(1)(a), which allows for closed meetings to discuss 'the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of an individual.'    
 
4. Following the closed session, the Board will return to an open meeting to make a decision regarding the continued employment of Dr. Drew Williams, and, if applicable, potential appointment of an interim principal.     
 
5. Adjournment.

Board of Tuachan High School for the Performing Arts

Notice is hereby given that Board of Tuacahn High School for the Performing Arts (THSA) will hold a
special public meeting on Monday, February 22, 2021 at 6 pm.  Due to Chair Hafen's determination
contained in the body of the below agenda, the public meeting will be held electronically via Zoom and
live streamed on THSA's YouTube channel.  Public meetings conducted via Zoom may be terminated at
any time due to hackers or inappropriate content.
 
Meetings of the Board may be conducted via electronic means pursuant to Utah Code Ann. 52-4-
209(2)(a) and 52-4-207, as amended. 
 
Members of the public wishing to provide written comment in advance of the meeting may send their
comments to Kent Brown, kbrown@tuacahnhs.org, 1100 Tuacahn Drive, Ivins, UT 84738.
 
Members of the public wishing to provide comment at the meeting should sign up to submit their
comments by contacting Kent Brown at kbrown@tuacahnhs.org or 435-652-3303.
 
Please note that in order to allow afford all interested members the opportunity to speak, comments
will be limited to 2 minutes.  Interested members who wish to provide more extensive comments are
invited to submit written comments to Kent Brown in advance of the meeting.
 
The THSA Board, in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, provides accommodations and
services for those members of the public in need of assistance.  Persons requesting these
accommodations for the above-scheduled public hearing should contact Kent Brown at
kbrown@tuacahnhs.org or 435-652-3303, giving at least 24 hours' notice prior to the meeting.
 
AGENDA
 
1. Roll Call
 
2. Chair's Determination Letter.  In accordance with Utah Code 52-4-209(2)(a) and 52-4-207(4) of the
Utah Open and Public Meeting Act, I have determined that conducting an electronic meeting of the
THSA Board with an anchor location presents a substantial risk to the health and safety of those who
may be present at the anchor location.  This determination is based on the facts and circumstances
surrounding the COVID-10 pandemic.  Considering the continued number of COVID-10 case counts in
Utah, meeting in an anchor location presents substantial risk to the health and safety of those in
attendance because physical distancing measures may be difficult to maintain at the anchor location.
Watch via YouTube Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcGR1APVDgBwCUmvuPGicOA
 
Join via Zoom Meeting:
Topic: Meeting of the Board of Tuacahn High School for the Performing Arts
Time: Feb 22, 2021 06:00 PM Mountain Time (US and Canada)
Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/86165117787?pwd=bmhGUGhPbmQrUDRnZDJMWjBzd21sQT09

Meeting ID: 861 6511 7787
Passcode: 945429
One tap mobile
+12532158782,,86165117787# US (Tacoma)
+13462487799,,86165117787# US (Houston)
Dial by your location

        +1 346 248 7799 US (Houston)
        +1 669 900 9128 US (San Jose)
        +1 301 715 8592 US (Washington DC)
        +1 312 626 6799 US (Chicago)
        +1 646 558 8656 US (New York)
Meeting ID: 861 6511 7787
Find your local number: https://us02web.zoom.us/u/kcWzunqiiq
3. Review and approval of minutes for December 5, 2020.
 
4.  Public Comment - Continued employment of Drew Williams as Principal of Tuacahn High School for
the Arts.
 
5.  Following public comment, the Chair intends to invite the Board to go into closed session pursuant to
Utah Code Ann. 52-4-205(1)(a), which allows for closed meetings to discuss "the character, professional
competence, or physical or mental health of an individual."
 
6. Following any closed session, the Board will return to an open meeting to make a decision regarding
the continued employment of Drew Williams, and, if applicable, potential appointment of an interim
principal.
 
7. Adjournment

meetings.agenda:
Utah Connections Academy (UCA)
BOARD MEETING

Date and Time:
Wednesday, April 21, 2021 at 5:30 p.m. MT

Held Via Teleconference:
Due to State Precautions and the Board Chair's Determination
regarding Public Health and Safety during COVID-19 Pandemic

1(800) 747-5150; Code 172-9385
_____________________________________________________________________________________________

Below is an agenda of all items scheduled to be considered. Unless otherwise stated, items may be taken out of the order presented on the agenda at the discretion of the Chair.  Persons with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation by contacting Erin Taylor at (385) 489-0444. Requests should be made as early as possible to arrange the accommodation; no later than twenty-four (24) hours prior to the meeting.

BOARD AGENDA

I.	Call to Order - S. Kinney

II.	Roll Call - S. Kinney

III.	Mission Statement - S. Kinney

Utah Connections Academy is a pioneering virtual public charter school whose mission is to maximize academic achievement for students in grades K-12 throughout the state of Utah who need an alternative to the traditional classroom.

IV.	Public Comment

The Board welcomes participation by the members of the public both in-person and telephonically. To address an item on the agenda, before the scheduled start of the meeting, an individual must write their name and a short description of the agenda item on which they wish to comment on the card provided and submit this to the Chair, along with any materials they want to have distributed to Board.  Individuals who wish to address the Board telephonically must contact the school principal by phone or by email at least twenty-four (24) hours before the scheduled start of the Board meeting. If the individual wants to provide any written materials to the Board, these should be emailed to the School Principal at least twenty-four (24) hours before the scheduled start of the meeting. 

The total time for any individual to present, either in person or via telephone, on an item on the agenda shall not exceed three (3) minutes, unless the Board grants additional time. 

Individuals desiring to make a formal presentation to the Board on an item not on the agenda but desiring it be placed on the agenda must provide notice and written submissions detailing the subject of the presentation to the School Principal at least fourteen (14) days prior to the meeting.  Any such presentations shall not exceed fifteen (15) minutes in duration, unless otherwise permitted by the Chair.

To view the Board Public Comment Policy, visit the school's 'Our School Board' page at www.connectionsacademy.com


 

V.	Audit Committee, Committee of the Entire Board
a.	Approval of Audit Firm Engagement of the 2020-2021 School Year Financial Audit (to follow) - T. Gianoni

VI.	Routine Business 
a.	Approval of Agenda - S. Kinney

VII.	Oral Reports
a.	School Leader's Report (MSR attached) - E. Taylor
i.	Graduation Plans and End of Year Activities Update
ii.	State Testing Update
iii.	Staffing Update
iv.	Enrollment Update
b.	Financial Report (attached) - T. Gianoni
i.	Board Support Update
ii.	2020-2021 Financial Framework Update

VIII.	Consent Items
a.	Approval of Minutes from the February 17, 2021 Board Meeting (attached)
b.	Approval of Staffing Report (attached) 
c.	Approval of Online & Blended Learning (OBL) Invoice(s) for February and March (attached)
d.	Approval of Staff Compensation Plan for the 2021-2022 School Year (attached) 
e.	Approval of School Calendar for the 2021-2022 School Year (attached)
f.	Approval of Revision(s) to 2020-2021 School Year State Specific Handbook: Attendance Updates (attached)
g.	Approval of School-Funded Summer School Scholarship Offering to Students (attached)

IX.	Action Items
a.	Approval of State LAND Trust Plan for the 2021-2022 School Year (attached) - E. Taylor
b.	Approval of Revised Charter Amendment relating to Charter School Goals and Appointment of Board Chair as Board Designee to Review, Finalize and Execute All Necessary Documents (attached) - E. Taylor

X.	Information Items
a.	Outreach Plan for the 2021-2022 School Year (attached) - J. Rotar
b.	State Account Relations (STAR) Update - E. Sigmund
i.	Review of Utah 2021 Legislative Session
c.	Partner School Leadership Team (PSLT) Update - J. Dukek
i.	School Operations Metrics (attached)
ii.	Service Spotlight (attached)
d.	Board Relations Update: Planning for the 2021-2022 School Year - L. Coleman
i.	Proposed Meeting Schedule
ii.	Board Composition
iii.	Board Requirements Reminders

XI.	Adjournment and Confirmation of the Next Board Meeting - Wednesday, May 19, 2021 at 5:30 p.m. MT

Individuals desiring to make a formal presentation to the Board on an item not on the agenda but desiring it be placed on the agenda must provide notice and written submissions detailing the subject of the presentation to the School Principal at least fourteen (14) days prior to the meeting.  Any such presentations shall not exceed fifteen (15) minutes in duration, unless otherwise permitted by the Chair.

To view the Board Public Comment Policy, visit the school's 'Our School Board' page at www.connectionsacademy.com
